questions.question: A company is looking to adopt ITIL practices to improve their service management. Which principle should they follow to ensure that the cost of service delivery is justified?
A service desk agent is resolving an incident but realizes that additional support is needed from a third-party vendor. Which ITIL practice should the agent engage in this scenario?

An organization is implementing ITIL 4 and wants to improve decision-making and decrease disruptions. Which concept promotes the understanding of workflow, roles, and activities necessary for the delivery of services?
An IT organization wants to ensure that their services are aligned with the needs of their customers and stakeholders. Which ITIL 4 practice assists with the facilitation of this alignment?
During a service transition, it’s important to manage changes in a coordinated way. Which ITIL practice provides guidance to accomplish this?
An organization is trying to gain a better understanding of their stakeholders’ needs, resources, and continual improvement. Which ITIL 4 dimension should they consider?
What is the primary purpose of the ITIL 'Service Request Management' practice?

choices.text: To support the agreed quality of a service by handling all predefined, user-initiated service requests in an effective way
To restore normal service operation as quickly as possible
To systematically observe services and service components
To align the organization’s practices and services with business needs

questions.question: What does the ITIL 'Continual Improvement Model' provide a structured approach for?

choices.text: Resolving service failures and ensuring components are functioning correctly
Assessing the maturity level of service management practices
Supporting the organization in improving its service management practices and services
Responding to customer feedback about service quality issues

questions.question: An IT firm leverages monitoring tools to detect and categorize events in relation to services and other configuration items. Which ITIL practice are they applying?
When a new service is being designed, which of the following considerations is MOST aligned with the 'Design and Transition' value chain activity in ITIL 4?

choices.text: Ensuring standardized procedures are used for efficient and prompt handling of all changes
Protecting the information needed by the organization to conduct its business
Understanding and managing all costs and types of demand
Planning and building a service that will meet the needs of current and future customers
